base

Class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • base.ComponentCollection
        • base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NeuronCollection, SynapseCollection

    public abstract class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>
extends ComponentCollection
implements ComponentConfigurationListener

    Base class for all collections of specific types of configurable neural network components. A ConfigurableComponentCollection may reference zero, one or more ComponentConfigurations by adding them via addConfiguration(ComponentConfiguration). Each component in the collection may reference one of these configurations, this is set via setComponentConfiguration(int componentIndex, int configurationIndex).

    See ComponentCollection for details on implementing component collections.

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to set the values for pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentCollection

        public void setComponentConfiguration(int componentIndex,
                             int configurationIndex)
        Set the configuration for a component. Parameterised implementations of a component should be accompanied by a configuration class extending ComponentConfiguration that allows specifying these parameters.
